page.title: 08FARMING IN BREAN
page.content: THERE ARE THREE FARMS IN THE AREA.BREAN DOWN FARM,BREAN FARM AND WARREN FARM.THE LATTER IS ALSO USED FOR A CARAVAN SITE WHICH STRETCHES FOR ABOUT TWO THIRDS KM ADJACENT TO THE ROAD.DAIRY FARMING TAKES PLACE AT ALL THREE FARMS,THIS IS DUE TO THE ALLIVIAL SOIL.STOCKS ARE ABOUT 150 TO 200 COWS PER FARM,THIS IS DUE TO THE SAND INTRUSION INTO THE ALLIVID SOIL AND THE RISK OF FLOODING FROM THE SEA.BREAN FARM IS THE CENTRE FOR SAND YACHTING A NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL SPORT WHICH TAKES PLACE ON BREAN FLATS EVERY YEAR.BREAN DOWN FARM WAS IN THE ORIGINAL DOOMSDAY BOOK AND HAS ALWAYS BEEN USED FOR DAIRY FARMING.THE FARM WAS VISITED BY SCHOOLCHILDREN FROM THE MIDLANDS UP TO 1982 AND A BOOK WAS WRITTEN ON THE FARM BY THE HEADMASTER OF ONE SCHOOL.
